   20: -module(prim_file_SUITE).
   21: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   22: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2, init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   23: 	 read_write_file/1, free_memory/0]).
   24: -export([cur_dir_0/1, cur_dir_1/1,
   25: 	 make_del_dir/1, pos1/1, pos2/1]).
   26: -export([close/1, delete/1]).
   27: -export([open1/1, modes/1]).
   28: -export([file_info_basic_file/1, file_info_basic_directory/1, file_info_bad/1,
   29: 	 file_info_times/1, file_write_file_info/1,
   30:          file_read_file_info_opts/1, file_write_file_info_opts/1,
   31: 	 file_write_read_file_info_opts/1]).
   32: -export([rename/1, access/1, truncate/1, datasync/1, sync/1,
   33: 	 read_write/1, pread_write/1, append/1, exclusive/1,
   34: 	 read_file_rename_race/1]).
   35: -export([e_delete/1, e_rename/1, e_make_dir/1, e_del_dir/1]).
   36: 
   37: -export([make_link/1, read_link_info_for_non_link/1,
   38: 	 symlinks/1,
   39: 	 list_dir_limit/1,
   40: 	 list_dir_error/1,
   41: 	 list_dir/1]).
   42: 
   43: -export([advise/1]).
   44: -export([large_write/1]).
   45: 
   46: %% System probe functions that might be handy to check from the shell
   47: -export([unix_free/1]).
   48: 
   49: -export([allocate/1]).
   50: 
   51: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   52: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   53: 
   54: -define(PRIM_FILE, prim_file).
   55: 
   56: suite() -> [].
   57: 
   58: all() -> 
   59:     [read_write_file, {group, dirs}, {group, files},
   60:      delete, rename, {group, errors}, {group, links},
   61:      list_dir_limit, list_dir].
   62: 
   63: groups() -> 
   64:     [{dirs, [],
   65:       [make_del_dir, cur_dir_0, cur_dir_1]},
   66:      {files, [],
   67:       [{group, open}, {group, pos}, {group, file_info},
   68:        truncate, sync, datasync, advise, large_write, allocate]},
   69:      {open, [],
   70:       [open1, modes, close, access, read_write, pread_write,
   71:        append, exclusive, read_file_rename_race]},
   72:      {pos, [], [pos1, pos2]},
   73:      {file_info, [],
   74:       [file_info_basic_file,file_info_basic_directory, file_info_bad,
   75:        file_info_times, file_write_file_info, file_read_file_info_opts,
   76:        file_write_file_info_opts, file_write_read_file_info_opts
   77:       ]},
   78:      {errors, [],
   79:       [e_delete, e_rename, e_make_dir, e_del_dir]},
   80:      {links, [],
   81:       [make_link, read_link_info_for_non_link, symlinks, list_dir_error]}].
   82: 
   83: init_per_testcase(large_write, Config) ->
   84:     {ok, Started} = application:ensure_all_started(os_mon),
   85:     [{started, Started}|Config];
   86: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
   87:     Config.
   88: 
   89: end_per_testcase(large_write, Config) ->
   90:     [application:stop(App) || App <- lists:reverse(proplists:get_value(started, Config))],
   91:     ok;
   92: end_per_testcase(_, _Config) ->
   93:     ok.
   94: 
   95: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   96:     Config.
   97: 
   98: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   99:     Config.
  100: 
  101: 
  102: init_per_suite(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  103:     os:internal_init_cmd_shell(),
  104:     case os:type() of
  105: 	{win32, _} ->
  106: 	    Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  107: 	    HasAccessTime =
  108: 		case file:read_file_info(Priv) of
  109: 		    {ok, #file_info{atime={_, {0, 0, 0}}}} ->
  110: 			%% This is a unfortunately a FAT file system.
  111: 			[no_access_time];
  112: 		    {ok, _} ->
  113: 			[]
  114: 		end,
  115: 	    HasAccessTime++Config;
  116: 	_ ->
  117: 	    Config
  118:     end.
  119: 
  120: end_per_suite(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  121:     case os:type() of
  122: 	{win32, _} ->
  123: 	    os:cmd("subst z: /d");
  124: 	_ ->
  125: 	    ok
  126:     end,
  127:     Config.
  128: 
  129: %% Matches a term (the last) against alternatives
  130: expect(X, _, X) ->
  131:     X;
  132: expect(_, X, X) ->
  133:     X.
  134: 
  135: expect(X, _, _, X) ->
  136:     X;
  137: expect(_, X, _, X) ->
  138:     X;
  139: expect(_, _, X, X) ->
  140:     X.
  141: 
  142: expect(X, _, _, _, X) ->
  143:     X;
  144: expect(_, X, _, _, X) ->
  145:     X;
  146: expect(_, _, X, _, X) ->
  147:     X;
  148: expect(_, _, _, X, X) ->
  149:     X.
  150: 
  151: %% Calculate the time difference
  152: time_dist({YY, MM, DD, H, M, S}, DT) ->
  153:     time_dist({{YY, MM, DD}, {H, M, S}}, DT);
  154: time_dist(DT, {YY, MM, DD, H, M, S}) ->
  155:     time_dist(DT, {{YY, MM, DD}, {H, M, S}});
  156: time_dist({_D1, _T1} = DT1, {_D2, _T2} = DT2) ->
  157:     calendar:datetime_to_gregorian_seconds(DT2)
  158: 	- calendar:datetime_to_gregorian_seconds(DT1).
  159: 
  160: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  161: 
  162: read_write_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  163:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  164:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
  165: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  166: 			 ++"_read_write_file"),
  167: 
  168:     %% Try writing and reading back some term
  169:     SomeTerm = {"This term",{will,be},[written,$t,$o],1,file,[]},
  170:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write_file(Name,term_to_binary(SomeTerm)),
  171:     {ok,Bin1} = ?PRIM_FILE:read_file(Name),
  172:     SomeTerm = binary_to_term(Bin1),
  173: 
  174:     %% Try a "null" term
  175:     NullTerm = [],
  176:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write_file(Name,term_to_binary(NullTerm)),
  177:     {ok,Bin2} = ?PRIM_FILE:read_file(Name),
  178:     NullTerm = binary_to_term(Bin2),
  179: 
  180:     %% Try some "complicated" types
  181:     BigNum = 123456789012345678901234567890,
  182:     ComplTerm = {self(),make_ref(),BigNum,3.14159},
  183:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write_file(Name,term_to_binary(ComplTerm)),
  184:     {ok,Bin3} = ?PRIM_FILE:read_file(Name),
  185:     ComplTerm = binary_to_term(Bin3),
  186: 
  187:     %% Try reading a nonexistent file
  188:     Name2 = filename:join(RootDir,
  189: 			  atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  190: 			  ++"_nonexistent_file"),
  191:     {error, enoent} = ?PRIM_FILE:read_file(Name2),
  192:     {error, enoent} = ?PRIM_FILE:read_file(""),
  193: 
  194:     %% Try writing to a bad filename
  195:     {error, enoent} =
  196: 	?PRIM_FILE:write_file("",term_to_binary(NullTerm)),
  197: 
  198:     %% Try writing something else than a binary
  199:     {error, badarg} = ?PRIM_FILE:write_file(Name,{1,2,3}),
  200:     {error, badarg} = ?PRIM_FILE:write_file(Name,self()),
  201: 
  202:     %% Some non-term binaries
  203:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write_file(Name,[]),
  204:     {ok,Bin4} = ?PRIM_FILE:read_file(Name),
  205:     0 = byte_size(Bin4),
  206: 
  207:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write_file(Name,[Bin1,[],[[Bin2]]]),
  208:     {ok,Bin5} = ?PRIM_FILE:read_file(Name),
  209:     {Bin1,Bin2} = split_binary(Bin5,byte_size(Bin1)),
  210: 
  211:     ok.
  212: 
  213: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  214: 
  215: make_del_dir(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  216:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  217:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
  218: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  219: 			   ++"_mk-dir"),
  220:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:make_dir(NewDir),
  221:     {error, eexist} = ?PRIM_FILE:make_dir(NewDir),
  222:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:del_dir(NewDir),
  223:     {error, enoent} = ?PRIM_FILE:del_dir(NewDir),
  224: 
  225:     %% Make sure we are not in a directory directly under test_server
  226:     %% as that would result in eacces errors when trying to delete '..',
  227:     %% because there are processes having that directory as current.
  228:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:make_dir(NewDir),
  229:     {ok, CurrentDir} = ?PRIM_FILE:get_cwd(),
  230:     case {os:type(), length(NewDir) >= 260 } of
  231: 	{{win32,_}, true} ->
  232: 	    io:format("Skip set_cwd for windows path longer than 260 (MAX_PATH)\n", []),
  233: 	    io:format("\nNewDir = ~p\n", [NewDir]);
  234: 	_ ->
  235: 	    ok = ?PRIM_FILE:set_cwd(NewDir)
  236:     end,
  237:     try
  238: 	%% Check that we get an error when trying to create...
  239: 	%% a deep directory
  240: 	NewDir2 = filename:join(RootDir,
  241: 				atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  242: 				++"_mk-dir-noexist/foo"),
  243: 	{error, enoent} = ?PRIM_FILE:make_dir(NewDir2),
  244: 	%% a nameless directory
  245: 	{error, enoent} = ?PRIM_FILE:make_dir(""),
  246: 	%% a directory with illegal name
  247: 	{error, badarg} = ?PRIM_FILE:make_dir('mk-dir'),
  248: 
  249: 	%% a directory with illegal name, even if it's a (bad) list
  250: 	{error, badarg} = ?PRIM_FILE:make_dir([1,2,3,{}]),
  251: 
  252: 	%% Maybe this isn't an error, exactly, but worth mentioning anyway:
  253: 	%% ok = ?PRIM_FILE:make_dir([$f,$o,$o,0,$b,$a,$r])),
  254: 	%% The above line works, and created a directory "./foo"
  255: 	%% More elegant would maybe have been to fail, or to really create
  256: 	%% a directory, but with a name that incorporates the "bar" part of
  257: 	%% the list, so that [$f,$o,$o,0,$f,$o,$o] wouldn't refer to the same
  258: 	%% dir. But this would slow it down.
  259: 
  260: 	%% Try deleting some bad directories
  261: 	%% Deleting the parent directory to the current, sounds dangerous, huh?
  262: 	%% Don't worry ;-) the parent directory should never be empty, right?
  263: 	case ?PRIM_FILE:del_dir("..") of
  264: 	    {error, eexist} -> ok;
  265: 	    {error, eacces} -> ok;	%OpenBSD
  266: 	    {error, einval} -> ok		%FreeBSD
  267: 	end,
  268: 	{error, enoent} = ?PRIM_FILE:del_dir(""),
  269: 	{error, badarg} = ?PRIM_FILE:del_dir([3,2,1,{}])
  270:     after
  271: 	ok = ?PRIM_FILE:set_cwd(CurrentDir)
  272:     end,
  273:     ok.
  274: 
  275: cur_dir_0(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  276:     %% Find out the current dir, and cd to it ;-)
  277:     {ok,BaseDir} = ?PRIM_FILE:get_cwd(),
  278:     Dir1 = BaseDir ++ "", %% Check that it's a string
  279:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:set_cwd(Dir1),
  280:     DirName = atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "_curdir",
  281: 
  282:     %% Make a new dir, and cd to that
  283:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  284:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir, DirName),
  285:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:make_dir(NewDir),
  286:     case {os:type(), length(NewDir) >= 260} of
  287: 	{{win32,_}, true} ->
  288: 	    io:format("Skip set_cwd for windows path longer than 260 (MAX_PATH):\n"),
  289: 	    io:format("\nNewDir = ~p\n", [NewDir]);
  290: 	_ ->
  291: 	    io:format("cd to ~s",[NewDir]),
  292: 	    ok = ?PRIM_FILE:set_cwd(NewDir),
  293: 
  294: 	    %% Create a file in the new current directory, and check that it
  295: 	    %% really is created there
  296: 	    UncommonName = "uncommon.fil",
  297: 	    {ok,Fd} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(UncommonName, [read, write]),
  298: 	    ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd),
  299: 	    {ok,NewDirFiles} = ?PRIM_FILE:list_dir("."),
  300: 	    true = lists:member(UncommonName,NewDirFiles),
  301: 
  302: 	    %% Delete the directory and return to the old current directory
  303: 	    %% and check that the created file isn't there (too!)
  304: 	    expect({error, einval}, {error, eacces}, {error, eexist},
  305: 		   ?PRIM_FILE:del_dir(NewDir)),
  306: 	    ?PRIM_FILE:delete(UncommonName),
  307: 	    {ok,[]} = ?PRIM_FILE:list_dir("."),
  308: 	    ok = ?PRIM_FILE:set_cwd(Dir1),
  309: 	    io:format("cd back to ~s",[Dir1]),
  310: 	    ok = ?PRIM_FILE:del_dir(NewDir),
  311: 	    {error, enoent} = ?PRIM_FILE:set_cwd(NewDir),
  312: 	    ok = ?PRIM_FILE:set_cwd(Dir1),
  313: 	    io:format("cd back to ~s",[Dir1]),
  314: 	    {ok,OldDirFiles} = ?PRIM_FILE:list_dir("."),
  315: 	    false = lists:member(UncommonName,OldDirFiles)
  316:     end,
  317: 
  318:     %% Try doing some bad things
  319:     {error, badarg} =
  320: 	?PRIM_FILE:set_cwd({foo,bar}),
  321:     {error, enoent} =
  322: 	?PRIM_FILE:set_cwd(""),
  323:     {error, enoent} =
  324: 	?PRIM_FILE:set_cwd(".......a......"),
  325:     {ok,BaseDir} =
  326: 	?PRIM_FILE:get_cwd(), %% Still there?
  327: 
  328:     %% On Windows, there should only be slashes, no backslashes,
  329:     %% in the return value of get_cwd().
  330:     %% (The test is harmless on Unix, because filenames usually
  331:     %% don't contain backslashes.)
  332: 
  333:     {ok, BaseDir} = ?PRIM_FILE:get_cwd(),
  334:     false = lists:member($\\, BaseDir),
  335: 
  336:     ok.
  337: 
  338: %% Tests ?PRIM_FILE:get_cwd/1.
  339: 
  340: cur_dir_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  341:     case os:type() of
  342: 	{win32, _} ->
  343: 	    win_cur_dir_1(Config);
  344: 	_ ->
  345: 	    {error, enotsup} =
  346: 		?PRIM_FILE:get_cwd("d:")
  347:     end,
  348:     ok.
  349: 
  350: win_cur_dir_1(_Config) ->
  351:     {ok, BaseDir} = ?PRIM_FILE:get_cwd(),
  352: 
  353:     %% Get the drive letter from the current directory,
  354:     %% and try to get current directory for that drive.
  355: 
  356:     [Drive, $:|_] = BaseDir,
  357:     {ok, BaseDir} = ?PRIM_FILE:get_cwd([Drive, $:]),
  358:     io:format("BaseDir = ~s\n", [BaseDir]),
  359: 
  360:     %% Unfortunately, there is no way to move away from the
  361:     %% current drive as we can't use the "subst" command from
  362:     %% a SSH connection. We can't test any more. Too bad.
  363: 
  364:     ok.
  365: 
  366: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  367: 
  368: 
  369: 
  370: open1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  371:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  372:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
  373: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  374: 			   ++"_files"),
  375:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:make_dir(NewDir),
  376:     Name = filename:join(NewDir, "foo1.fil"),
  377:     {ok,Fd1} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Name, [read, write]),
  378:     {ok,Fd2} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Name, [read]),
  379:     Bin = list_to_binary("{a,tuple}.\n"),
  380:     Length = byte_size(Bin),
  381:     ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd1,Bin),
  382:     {ok,0} = ?PRIM_FILE:position(Fd1,bof),
  383:     {ok, Bin} = ?PRIM_FILE:read(Fd1,Length),
  384:     {ok, Bin} = ?PRIM_FILE:read(Fd2,Length),
  385:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd2),
  386:     {ok,0} = ?PRIM_FILE:position(Fd1,bof),
  387:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:truncate(Fd1),
  388:     eof = ?PRIM_FILE:read(Fd1,Length),
  389:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd1),
  390:     {ok,Fd3} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Name, [read]),
  391:     eof = ?PRIM_FILE:read(Fd3,Length),
  392:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd3),
  393:     ok.
  394: 
  395: %% Tests all open modes.
  396: 
  397: modes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  398:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  399:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
  400: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  401: 			   ++"_open_modes"),
  402:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:make_dir(NewDir),
  403:     Name1 = filename:join(NewDir, "foo1.fil"),
  404:     Marker = <<"hello, world">>,
  405:     Length = byte_size(Marker),
  406: 
  407:     %% write
  408:     {ok, Fd1} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Name1, [write]),
  409:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd1, Marker),
  410:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd1, <<".\n">>),
  411:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd1),
  412: 
  413:     %% read
  414:     {ok, Fd2} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Name1, [read]),
  415:     {ok, Marker} = ?PRIM_FILE:read(Fd2, Length),
  416:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd2),
  417: 
  418:     %% read and write
  419:     {ok, Fd3} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Name1, [read, write]),
  420:     {ok, Marker} = ?PRIM_FILE:read(Fd3, Length),
  421:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd3, Marker),
  422:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd3),
  423: 
  424:     %% read by default
  425:     {ok, Fd4} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Name1, []),
  426:     {ok, Marker} = ?PRIM_FILE:read(Fd4, Length),
  427:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd4),
  428: 
  429:     ok.
  430: 
  431: close(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  432:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  433:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
  434: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  435: 			 ++"_close.fil"),
  436:     {ok,Fd1} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Name, [read, write]),
  437:     %% Just closing it is no fun, we did that a million times already
  438:     %% This is a common error, for code written before Erlang 4.3
  439:     %% because then ?PRIM_FILE:open just returned a Pid, and not everyone
  440:     %% really checked what they got.
  441:     {'EXIT',_Msg} = (catch ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close({ok,Fd1})),
  442:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd1),
  443: 
  444:     %% Try closing one more time
  445:     Val = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd1),
  446:     io:format("Second close gave: ~p", [Val]),
  447: 
  448:     ok.
  449: 
  450: access(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  451:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  452:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
  453: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  454: 			 ++"_access.fil"),
  455:     Bin = <<"ABCDEFGH">>,
  456:     {ok,Fd1} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Name, [write]),
  457:     ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd1,Bin),
  458:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd1),
  459:     %% Check that we can't write when in read only mode
  460:     {ok,Fd2} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Name, [read]),
  461:     case catch ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd2,"XXXX") of
  462: 	ok ->
  463: 	    ct:fail({access,write});
  464: 	_ ->
  465: 	    ok
  466:     end,
  467:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd2),
  468:     {ok, Fd3} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Name, [read]),
  469:     {ok, Bin} = ?PRIM_FILE:read(Fd3,byte_size(Bin)),
  470:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd3),
  471: 
  472:     ok.
  473: 
  474: %% Tests ?PRIM_FILE:read/2 and ?PRIM_FILE:write/2.
  475: 
  476: read_write(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  477:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  478:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
  479: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  480: 			   ++"_read_write"),
  481:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:make_dir(NewDir),
  482: 
  483:     %% Raw file.
  484:     Name = filename:join(NewDir, "raw.fil"),
  485:     {ok, Fd} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Name, [read, write]),
  486:     read_write_test(Fd),
  487: 
  488:     ok.
  489: 
  490: read_write_test(File) ->
  491:     Marker = <<"hello, world">>,
  492:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write(File, Marker),
  493:     {ok, 0} = ?PRIM_FILE:position(File, 0),
  494:     {ok, Marker} = ?PRIM_FILE:read(File, 100),
  495:     eof = ?PRIM_FILE:read(File, 100),
  496:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(File),
  497:     ok.
  498: 
  499: 
  500: %% Tests ?PRIM_FILE:pread/2 and ?PRIM_FILE:pwrite/2.
  501: 
  502: pread_write(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  503:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  504:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
  505: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  506: 			   ++"_pread_write"),
  507:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:make_dir(NewDir),
  508: 
  509:     %% Raw file.
  510:     Name = filename:join(NewDir, "raw.fil"),
  511:     {ok, Fd} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Name, [read, write]),
  512:     pread_write_test(Fd),
  513: 
  514:     ok.
  515: 
  516: pread_write_test(File) ->
  517:     Marker = <<"hello, world">>,
  518:     Len = byte_size(Marker),
  519:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write(File, Marker),
  520:     {ok, Marker} = ?PRIM_FILE:pread(File, 0, 100),
  521:     eof = ?PRIM_FILE:pread(File, 100, 1),
  522:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:pwrite(File, Len, Marker),
  523:     {ok, Marker} = ?PRIM_FILE:pread(File, Len, 100),
  524:     eof = ?PRIM_FILE:pread(File, 100, 1),
  525:     MM = <<Marker/binary,Marker/binary>>,
  526:     {ok, MM} = ?PRIM_FILE:pread(File, 0, 100),
  527:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(File),
  528:     ok.
  529: 
  530: %% Test appending to a file.
  531: append(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  532:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  533:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
  534: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  535: 			   ++"_append"),
  536:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:make_dir(NewDir),
  537: 
  538:     First = "First line\n",
  539:     Second = "Second lines comes here\n",
  540:     Third = "And here is the third line\n",
  541: 
  542:     %% Write a small text file.
  543:     Name1 = filename:join(NewDir, "a_file.txt"),
  544:     {ok, Fd1} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Name1, [write]),
  545:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd1, First),
  546:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd1, Second),
  547:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd1),
  548: 
  549:     %% Open it a again and a append a line to it.
  550:     {ok, Fd2} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Name1, [append]),
  551:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd2, Third),
  552:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd2),
  553: 
  554:     %% Read it back and verify.
  555:     Expected = list_to_binary([First, Second, Third]),
  556:     {ok, Expected} = ?PRIM_FILE:read_file(Name1),
  557: 
  558:     ok.
  559: 
  560: %% Test exclusive access to a file.
  561: exclusive(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  562:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  563:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
  564: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  565: 			   ++"_exclusive"),
  566:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:make_dir(NewDir),
  567:     Name = filename:join(NewDir, "ex_file.txt"),
  568:     {ok,Fd} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Name, [write, exclusive]),
  569:     {error, eexist} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Name, [write, exclusive]),
  570:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd),
  571:     ok.
  572: 
  573: %% Test read_file with concurrent renames and size changes.
  574: 
  575: -define(RFRR_DATA1, <<"gazonk">>).
  576: -define(RFRR_DATA2, <<"fubar">>). % shorter than and not a prefix of DATA1
  577: 
  578: read_file_rename_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  579:     %% This test reportedly fails on Windows and Darwin 9.8.0.
  580:     Supported =
  581: 	case os:type() of
  582: 	    {win32, _} -> false;
  583: 	    {unix, darwin} -> os:version() > {9,8,0};
  584: 	    {unix, _} -> true
  585: 	end,
  586:     if Supported ->
  587: 	Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  588: 	Name = filename:join(Dir, "filename"),
  589: 	rfrr_write_file(Name, ?RFRR_DATA2),
  590: 	Mutator = spawn_link(fun() -> rfrr_mutator(Name, ?RFRR_DATA1, ?RFRR_DATA2) end),
  591: 	Result = rfrr_reader(Name, 1, _N = 5000),
  592: 	unlink(Mutator),
  593: 	exit(Mutator, kill),
  594: 	ok = Result;
  595:        true ->
  596: 	{skipped, "Not supported on Windows, or Darwin =< 9.8.0"}
  597:     end.
  598: 
  599: rfrr_reader(Name, I, N) when I < N ->
  600:     case rfrr_read_file(Name, I) of
  601: 	ok -> rfrr_reader(Name, I + 1, N);
  602: 	error -> error
  603:     end;
  604: rfrr_reader(_Name, _I, _N) -> ok.
  605: 
  606: rfrr_read_file(Name, I) ->
  607:     case prim_file:read_file(Name) of
  608: 	{ok, ?RFRR_DATA1} -> ok;
  609: 	{ok, ?RFRR_DATA2} -> ok;
  610: 	Other ->
  611: 	    io:format(standard_error, "rfrr_read_file #~p got ~p\n", [I, Other]),
  612: 	    error
  613:     end.
  614: 
  615: %% Correctness of read_file must not depend on the mutator using the
  616: %% file server in the reader's Erlang VM, so we use prim_file here.
  617: rfrr_mutator(Name, Data1, Data2) ->
  618:     rfrr_write_file(Name, Data1),
  619:     rfrr_mutator(Name, Data2, Data1).
  620: 
  621: %% Atomically replace Name with a new file containing Data.
  622: rfrr_write_file(Name, Data) ->
  623:     NameTmp = Name ++ ".tmp", % must be in same volume as Name
  624:     ok = prim_file:write_file(NameTmp, Data),
  625:     ok = prim_file:rename(NameTmp, Name).
  626: 
  627: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  628: 
  629: 
  630: pos1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  631:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  632:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
  633: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  634: 			 ++"_pos1.fil"),
  635:     {ok, Fd1} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Name, [write]),
  636:     ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd1,<<"ABCDEFGH">>),
  637:     ok        = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd1),
  638:     {ok, Fd2} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Name, [read]),
  639: 
  640:     %% Start pos is first char
  641:     io:format("Relative positions"),
  642:     {ok, <<"A">>} = ?PRIM_FILE:read(Fd2,1),
  643:     {ok, 2}   = ?PRIM_FILE:position(Fd2,{cur,1}),
  644:     {ok, <<"C">>} = ?PRIM_FILE:read(Fd2,1),
  645:     {ok, 0}   = ?PRIM_FILE:position(Fd2,{cur,-3}),
  646:     {ok, <<"A">>} = ?PRIM_FILE:read(Fd2,1),
  647:     %% Backwards from first char should be an error
  648:     {ok,0}    = ?PRIM_FILE:position(Fd2,{cur,-1}),
  649:     {error, einval} = ?PRIM_FILE:position(Fd2,{cur,-1}),
  650:     %% Reset position and move again
  651:     {ok, 0}   = ?PRIM_FILE:position(Fd2,0),
  652:     {ok, 2}   = ?PRIM_FILE:position(Fd2,{cur,2}),
  653:     {ok, <<"C">>} = ?PRIM_FILE:read(Fd2,1),
  654:     %% Go a lot forwards
  655:     {ok, 13}  = ?PRIM_FILE:position(Fd2,{cur,10}),
  656:     eof       = ?PRIM_FILE:read(Fd2,1),
  657: 
  658:     %% Try some fixed positions
  659:     io:format("Fixed positions"),
  660:     {ok, 8}   = ?PRIM_FILE:position(Fd2,8),
  661:     eof = ?PRIM_FILE:read(Fd2,1),
  662:     {ok, 8}   = ?PRIM_FILE:position(Fd2,cur),
  663:     eof = ?PRIM_FILE:read(Fd2,1),
  664:     {ok, 7}   = ?PRIM_FILE:position(Fd2,7),
  665:     {ok, <<"H">>} = ?PRIM_FILE:read(Fd2,1),
  666:     {ok, 0}   = ?PRIM_FILE:position(Fd2,0),
  667:     {ok, <<"A">>} = ?PRIM_FILE:read(Fd2,1),
  668:     {ok, 3}   = ?PRIM_FILE:position(Fd2,3),
  669:     {ok, <<"D">>} = ?PRIM_FILE:read(Fd2,1),
  670:     {ok, 12}  = ?PRIM_FILE:position(Fd2,12),
  671:     eof       = ?PRIM_FILE:read(Fd2,1),
  672:     {ok, 3}   = ?PRIM_FILE:position(Fd2,3),
  673:     {ok, <<"D">>} = ?PRIM_FILE:read(Fd2,1),
  674:     %% Try the {bof,X} notation
  675:     {ok, 3}   = ?PRIM_FILE:position(Fd2,{bof,3}),
  676:     {ok, <<"D">>} = ?PRIM_FILE:read(Fd2,1),
  677: 
  678:     %% Try eof positions
  679:     io:format("EOF positions"),
  680:     {ok, 8}   = ?PRIM_FILE:position(Fd2,{eof,0}),
  681:     eof       = ?PRIM_FILE:read(Fd2,1),
  682:     {ok, 7}   = ?PRIM_FILE:position(Fd2,{eof,-1}),
  683:     {ok, <<"H">>} = ?PRIM_FILE:read(Fd2,1),
  684:     {ok, 0}   = ?PRIM_FILE:position(Fd2,{eof,-8}),
  685:     {ok, <<"A">>} = ?PRIM_FILE:read(Fd2,1),
  686:     {error, einval} = ?PRIM_FILE:position(Fd2,{eof,-9}),
  687:     ok.
  688: 
  689: pos2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  690:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  691:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
  692: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  693: 			 ++"_pos2.fil"),
  694:     {ok,Fd1} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Name, [write]),
  695:     ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd1,<<"ABCDEFGH">>),
  696:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd1),
  697:     {ok, Fd2} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Name, [read]),
  698:     {error, einval} = ?PRIM_FILE:position(Fd2,-1),
  699: 
  700:     %% Make sure that we still can search after an error.
  701:     {ok, 0}   = ?PRIM_FILE:position(Fd2, 0),
  702:     {ok, 3}   = ?PRIM_FILE:position(Fd2, {bof,3}),
  703:     {ok, <<"D">>} = ?PRIM_FILE:read(Fd2,1),
  704: 
  705:     io:format("DONE"),
  706:     ok.
  707: 
  708: file_info_basic_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  709:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  710: 
  711:     %% Create a short file.
  712:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
  713: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  714: 			 ++"_basic_test.fil"),
  715:     {ok,Fd1} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Name, [write]),
  716:     ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd1, "foo bar"),
  717:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd1),
  718: 
  719:     %% Test that the file has the expected attributes.
  720:     %% The times are tricky, so we will save them to a separate test case.
  721:     {ok, FileInfo} = ?PRIM_FILE:read_file_info(Name),
  722:     #file_info{size = Size, type = Type, access = Access,
  723: 	       atime = AccessTime, mtime = ModifyTime} =
  724: 	FileInfo,
  725:     io:format("Access ~p, Modify ~p", [AccessTime, ModifyTime]),
  726:     Size = 7,
  727:     Type = regular,
  728:     Access = read_write,
  729:     true = abs(time_dist(filter_atime(AccessTime, Config),
  730: 			 filter_atime(ModifyTime,
  731: 				      Config))) < 2,
  732:     {AD, AT} = AccessTime,
  733:     all_integers(tuple_to_list(AD) ++ tuple_to_list(AT)),
  734:     {MD, MT} = ModifyTime,
  735:     all_integers(tuple_to_list(MD) ++ tuple_to_list(MT)),
  736: 
  737:     ok.
  738: 
  739: file_info_basic_directory(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  740:     %% Note: filename:join/1 removes any trailing slash,
  741:     %% which is essential for ?PRIM_FILE:read_file_info/1 to work on
  742:     %% platforms such as Windows95.
  743:     RootDir = filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)]),
  744: 
  745:     %% Test that the RootDir directory has the expected attributes.
  746:     test_directory(RootDir, read_write),
  747: 
  748:     %% Note that on Windows file systems, "/" or "c:/" are *NOT* directories.
  749:     %% Therefore, test that ?PRIM_FILE:read_file_info/1 behaves 
  750:     %% as if they were directories.
  751:     case os:type() of
  752: 	{win32, _} ->
  753: 	    test_directory("/", read_write),
  754: 	    test_directory("c:/", read_write),
  755: 	    test_directory("c:\\", read_write);
  756: 	_ ->
  757: 	    test_directory("/", read)
  758:     end,
  759:     ok.
  760: 
  761: test_directory(Name, ExpectedAccess) ->
  762:     {ok, FileInfo} = ?PRIM_FILE:read_file_info(Name),
  763:     #file_info{size = Size, type = Type, access = Access,
  764: 	       atime = AccessTime, mtime = ModifyTime} =
  765: 	FileInfo,
  766:     io:format("Testing directory ~s", [Name]),
  767:     io:format("Directory size is ~p", [Size]),
  768:     io:format("Access ~p", [Access]),
  769:     io:format("Access time ~p; Modify time~p",
  770: 	      [AccessTime, ModifyTime]),
  771:     Type = directory,
  772:     Access = ExpectedAccess,
  773:     {AD, AT} = AccessTime,
  774:     all_integers(tuple_to_list(AD) ++ tuple_to_list(AT)),
  775:     {MD, MT} = ModifyTime,
  776:     all_integers(tuple_to_list(MD) ++ tuple_to_list(MT)),
  777:     ok.
  778: 
  779: all_integers([Int|Rest]) when is_integer(Int) ->
  780:     all_integers(Rest);
  781: all_integers([]) ->
  782:     ok.
  783: 
  784: %% Try something nonexistent.
  785: 
  786: file_info_bad(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  787:     RootDir = filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)]),
  788:     NonExistent = filename:join(RootDir, atom_to_list(?MODULE)++"_nonexistent"),
  789:     {error, enoent} = ?PRIM_FILE:read_file_info(NonExistent),
  790:     ok.
  791: 
  792: %% Test that the file times behave as they should.
  793: 
  794: file_info_times(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  795:     %% We have to try this twice, since if the test runs across the change
  796:     %% of a month the time diff calculations will fail. But it won't happen
  797:     %% if you run it twice in succession.
  798:     test_server:m_out_of_n(
  799:       1,2,
  800:       fun() -> file_info_int(Config) end),
  801:     ok.
  802: 
  803: file_info_int(Config) ->
  804:     %% Note: filename:join/1 removes any trailing slash,
  805:     %% which is essential for ?PRIM_FILE:read_file_info/1 to work on
  806:     %% platforms such as Windows95.
  807: 
  808:     RootDir = filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)]),
  809:     io:format("RootDir = ~p", [RootDir]),
  810: 
  811:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
  812: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  813: 			 ++"_file_info.fil"),
  814:     {ok,Fd1} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Name, [write]),
  815:     ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd1,"foo"),
  816: 
  817:     %% check that the file got a modify date max a few seconds away from now
  818:     {ok, #file_info{type = regular,
  819: 		    atime = AccTime1, mtime = ModTime1}} =
  820: 	?PRIM_FILE:read_file_info(Name),
  821:     Now = erlang:localtime(),
  822:     io:format("Now ~p",[Now]),
  823:     io:format("Open file Acc ~p Mod ~p",[AccTime1,ModTime1]),
  824:     true = abs(time_dist(filter_atime(Now, Config),
  825: 			 filter_atime(AccTime1,
  826: 				      Config))) < 8,
  827:     true = abs(time_dist(Now, ModTime1)) < 8,
  828: 
  829:     %% Sleep until we can be sure the seconds value has changed.
  830:     %% Note: FAT-based filesystem (like on Windows 95) have
  831:     %% a resolution of 2 seconds.
  832:     ct:sleep({seconds,2.2}),
  833: 
  834:     %% close the file, and watch the modify date change
  835:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd1),
  836:     {ok, #file_info{size = Size, type = regular, access = Access,
  837: 		    atime = AccTime2, mtime = ModTime2}} =
  838: 	?PRIM_FILE:read_file_info(Name),
  839:     io:format("Closed file Acc ~p Mod ~p",[AccTime2,ModTime2]),
  840:     true = time_dist(ModTime1, ModTime2) >= 0,
  841: 
  842:     %% this file is supposed to be binary, so it'd better keep it's size
  843:     Size = 3,
  844:     Access = read_write,
  845: 
  846:     %% Do some directory checking
  847:     {ok, #file_info{size = DSize, type = directory,
  848: 		    access = DAccess,
  849: 		    atime = AccTime3, mtime = ModTime3}} =
  850: 	?PRIM_FILE:read_file_info(RootDir),
  851:     %% this dir was modified only a few secs ago
  852:     io:format("Dir Acc ~p; Mod ~p; Now ~p",
  853: 	      [AccTime3, ModTime3, Now]),
  854:     true = abs(time_dist(Now, ModTime3)) < 5,
  855:     DAccess = read_write,
  856:     io:format("Dir size is ~p",[DSize]),
  857:     ok.
  858: 
  859: %% Filter access times, to cope with a deficiency of FAT file systems
  860: %% (on Windows): The access time is actually only a date.
  861: 
  862: filter_atime(Atime, Config) ->
  863:     case lists:member(no_access_time, Config) of
  864: 	true ->
  865: 	    case Atime of
  866: 	    	{Date, _} ->
  867: 		    {Date, {0, 0, 0}};
  868: 		{Y, M, D, _, _, _} ->
  869: 		    {Y, M, D, 0, 0, 0}
  870: 	    end;
  871: 	false ->
  872: 	    Atime
  873:     end.
  874: 
  875: %% Test the write_file_info/2 function.
  876: 
  877: file_write_file_info(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  878:     RootDir = get_good_directory(Config),
  879:     io:format("RootDir = ~p", [RootDir]),
  880: 
  881:     %% Set the file to read only AND update the file times at the same time.
  882:     %% (This used to fail on Windows NT/95 for a local filesystem.)
  883:     %% Note: Seconds must be even; see note in file_info_times/1.
  884: 
  885:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
  886: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  887: 			 ++"_write_file_info_ro"),
  888:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write_file(Name, "hello"),
  889:     Time = {{1997, 01, 02}, {12, 35, 42}},
  890:     Info = #file_info{mode=8#400, atime=Time, mtime=Time, ctime=Time},
  891:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write_file_info(Name, Info),
  892: 
  893:     %% Read back the times.
  894: 
  895:     {ok, ActualInfo} =
  896: 	?PRIM_FILE:read_file_info(Name),
  897:     #file_info{mode=_Mode, atime=ActAtime, mtime=Time,
  898: 	       ctime=ActCtime} = ActualInfo,
  899:     FilteredAtime = filter_atime(Time, Config),
  900:     FilteredAtime = filter_atime(ActAtime, Config),
  901:     case os:type() of
  902: 	{win32, _} ->
  903: 	    %% On Windows, "ctime" means creation time and it can
  904: 	    %% be set.
  905: 	    ActCtime = Time;
  906: 	_ ->
  907: 	    ok
  908:     end,
  909:     {error, eacces} = ?PRIM_FILE:write_file(Name, "hello again"),
  910: 
  911:     %% Make the file writable again.
  912:     ?PRIM_FILE:write_file_info(Name, #file_info{mode=8#600}),
  913:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write_file(Name, "hello again"),
  914: 
  915:     %% And unwritable.
  916:     ?PRIM_FILE:write_file_info(Name, #file_info{mode=8#400}),
  917:     {error, eacces} = ?PRIM_FILE:write_file(Name, "hello again"),
  918: 
  919:     %% Write the times again.
  920:     %% Note: Seconds must be even; see note in file_info_times/1.
  921: 
  922:     NewTime = {{1997, 02, 15}, {13, 18, 20}},
  923:     NewInfo = #file_info{atime=NewTime, mtime=NewTime, ctime=NewTime},
  924:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write_file_info(Name, NewInfo),
  925:     {ok, ActualInfo2} =
  926: 	?PRIM_FILE:read_file_info(Name),
  927:     #file_info{atime=NewActAtime, mtime=NewTime,
  928: 	       ctime=NewActCtime} = ActualInfo2,
  929:     NewFilteredAtime = filter_atime(NewTime, Config),
  930:     NewFilteredAtime = filter_atime(NewActAtime, Config),
  931:     case os:type() of
  932: 	{win32, _} -> NewActCtime = NewTime;
  933: 	_ -> ok
  934:     end,
  935: 
  936:     %% The file should still be unwritable.
  937:     {error, eacces} = ?PRIM_FILE:write_file(Name, "hello again"),
  938: 
  939:     %% Make the file writeable again, so that we can remove the
  940:     %% test suites ... :-)
  941:     ?PRIM_FILE:write_file_info(Name, #file_info{mode=8#600}),
  942:     ok.
  943: 
  944: %% Test the write_file_info/3 function.
  945: 
  946: file_write_file_info_opts(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  947:     RootDir = get_good_directory(Config),
  948:     io:format("RootDir = ~p", [RootDir]),
  949: 
  950:     Name = filename:join(RootDir, atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++"_write_file_info_opts"),
  951:     ok   = ?PRIM_FILE:write_file(Name, "hello_opts"),
  952: 
  953:     lists:foreach(fun
  954: 		      ({FI, Opts}) ->
  955: 			 ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write_file_info(Name, FI, Opts)
  956: 		 end, [
  957: 			{#file_info{ mode=8#600, atime = Time, mtime = Time, ctime = Time}, Opts} ||
  958: 			  Opts <- [[{time, posix}]],
  959: 			  Time <- [ 0,1,-1,100,-100,1000,-1000,10000,-10000 ]
  960: 		      ]),
  961: 
  962:     %% REM: determine date range dependent on time_t = Uint32 | Sint32 | Sint64 | Uint64
  963:     %% Determine time_t on os:type()?
  964:     lists:foreach(fun ({FI, Opts}) ->
  965: 			 ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write_file_info(Name, FI, Opts)
  966: 		 end, [ {#file_info{ mode=8#400, atime = Time, mtime = Time, ctime = Time}, Opts} ||
  967: 			  Opts <- [[{time, universal}],[{time, local}]],
  968: 			  Time <- [
  969: 				   {{1970,1,1},{0,0,0}},
  970: 				   {{1970,1,1},{0,0,1}},
  971: 			%	   {{1969,12,31},{23,59,59}},
  972: 			%	   {{1908,2,3},{23,59,59}},
  973: 				   {{2012,2,3},{23,59,59}},
  974: 				   {{2037,2,3},{23,59,59}},
  975: 				   erlang:localtime()
  976: 				  ]]),
  977:     ok.
  978: 
  979: file_read_file_info_opts(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  980:     RootDir = get_good_directory(Config),
  981:     io:format("RootDir = ~p", [RootDir]),
  982: 
  983:     Name = filename:join(RootDir, atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++"_read_file_info_opts"),
  984:     ok   = ?PRIM_FILE:write_file(Name, "hello_opts"),
  985: 
  986:     lists:foreach(fun
  987: 		      (Opts) ->
  988: 			 {ok,_} = ?PRIM_FILE:read_file_info(Name, Opts)
  989: 		 end, [[{time, Type}] || Type <- [local, universal, posix]]),
  990:     ok.
  991: 
  992: %% Test the write and read back *_file_info/3 functions.
  993: 
  994: file_write_read_file_info_opts(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  995:     RootDir = get_good_directory(Config),
  996:     io:format("RootDir = ~p", [RootDir]),
  997: 
  998:     Name = filename:join(RootDir, atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++"_read_write_file_info_opts"),
  999:     ok   = ?PRIM_FILE:write_file(Name, "hello_opts2"),
 1000: 
 1001:     ok = file_write_read_file_info_opts(Name, {{1989, 04, 28}, {19,30,22}}, [{time, local}]),
 1002:     ok = file_write_read_file_info_opts(Name, {{1989, 04, 28}, {19,30,22}}, [{time, universal}]),
 1003:     %% will not work on platforms with unsigned time_t
 1004:     %ok = file_write_read_file_info_opts(Name, {{1930, 04, 28}, {19,30,22}}, [{time, local}]),
 1005:     %ok = file_write_read_file_info_opts(Name, {{1930, 04, 28}, {19,30,22}}, [{time, universal}]),
 1006:     ok = file_write_read_file_info_opts(Name, 1, [{time, posix}]),
 1007:     %% will not work on platforms with unsigned time_t
 1008:     %ok = file_write_read_file_info_opts(Name, -1, [{time, posix}]),
 1009:     %ok = file_write_read_file_info_opts(Name, -300000, [{time, posix}]),
 1010:     ok = file_write_read_file_info_opts(Name, 300000, [{time, posix}]),
 1011:     ok = file_write_read_file_info_opts(Name, 0, [{time, posix}]),
 1012: 
 1013:     ok.
 1014: 
 1015: file_write_read_file_info_opts(Name, Mtime, Opts) ->
 1016:     {ok, FI} = ?PRIM_FILE:read_file_info(Name, Opts),
 1017:     FI2 = FI#file_info{ mtime = Mtime },
 1018:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write_file_info(Name, FI2, Opts),
 1019:     {ok, FI3} = ?PRIM_FILE:read_file_info(Name, Opts),
 1020:     io:format("Expecting mtime = ~p, got ~p~n", [FI2#file_info.mtime, FI3#file_info.mtime]),
 1021:     FI2 = FI3,
 1022:     ok.
 1023: 
 1024: 
 1025: 
 1026: %% Returns a directory on a file system that has correct file times.
 1027: 
 1028: get_good_directory(Config) ->
 1029:     proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config).
 1030: 
 1031: truncate(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1032:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1033:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 1034: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1035: 			 ++"_truncate.fil"),
 1036: 
 1037:     %% Create a file with some data.
 1038:     MyData = "0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvxyz",
 1039:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write_file(Name, MyData),
 1040: 
 1041:     %% Truncate the file to 10 characters.
 1042:     {ok, Fd} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Name, [read, write]),
 1043:     {ok, 10} = ?PRIM_FILE:position(Fd, 10),
 1044:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:truncate(Fd),
 1045:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd),
 1046: 
 1047:     %% Read back the file and check that it has been truncated.
 1048:     Expected = list_to_binary("0123456789"),
 1049:     {ok, Expected} = ?PRIM_FILE:read_file(Name),
 1050: 
 1051:     %% Open the file read only and verify that it is not possible to
 1052:     %% truncate it, OTP-1960
 1053:     {ok, Fd2} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Name, [read]),
 1054:     {ok, 5} = ?PRIM_FILE:position(Fd2, 5),
 1055:     {error, _} = ?PRIM_FILE:truncate(Fd2),
 1056: 
 1057:     ok.
 1058: 
 1059: 
 1060: %% Tests that ?PRIM_FILE:datasync/1 at least doesn't crash.
 1061: datasync(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1062:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1063:     Sync = filename:join(PrivDir,
 1064: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1065: 			 ++"_sync.fil"),
 1066: 
 1067:     %% Raw open.
 1068:     {ok, Fd} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Sync, [write]),
 1069:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:datasync(Fd),
 1070:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd),
 1071: 
 1072:     ok.
 1073: 
 1074: 
 1075: %% Tests that ?PRIM_FILE:sync/1 at least doesn't crash.
 1076: sync(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1077:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1078:     Sync = filename:join(PrivDir,
 1079: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1080: 			 ++"_sync.fil"),
 1081: 
 1082:     %% Raw open.
 1083:     {ok, Fd} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Sync, [write]),
 1084:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:sync(Fd),
 1085:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd),
 1086: 
 1087:     ok.
 1088: 
 1089: 
 1090: %% Tests that ?PRIM_FILE:advise/4 at least doesn't crash.
 1091: advise(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1092:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1093:     Advise = filename:join(PrivDir,
 1094: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1095: 			   ++"_advise.fil"),
 1096: 
 1097:     Line1 = <<"Hello\n">>,
 1098:     Line2 = <<"World!\n">>,
 1099: 
 1100:     {ok, Fd} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Advise, [write]),
 1101:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:advise(Fd, 0, 0, normal),
 1102:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd, Line1),
 1103:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd, Line2),
 1104:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd),
 1105: 
 1106:     {ok, Fd2} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Advise, [write]),
 1107:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:advise(Fd2, 0, 0, random),
 1108:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd2, Line1),
 1109:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd2, Line2),
 1110:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd2),
 1111: 
 1112:     {ok, Fd3} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Advise, [write]),
 1113:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:advise(Fd3, 0, 0, sequential),
 1114:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd3, Line1),
 1115:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd3, Line2),
 1116:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd3),
 1117: 
 1118:     {ok, Fd4} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Advise, [write]),
 1119:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:advise(Fd4, 0, 0, will_need),
 1120:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd4, Line1),
 1121:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd4, Line2),
 1122:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd4),
 1123: 
 1124:     {ok, Fd5} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Advise, [write]),
 1125:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:advise(Fd5, 0, 0, dont_need),
 1126:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd5, Line1),
 1127:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd5, Line2),
 1128:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd5),
 1129: 
 1130:     {ok, Fd6} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Advise, [write]),
 1131:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:advise(Fd6, 0, 0, no_reuse),
 1132:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd6, Line1),
 1133:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd6, Line2),
 1134:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd6),
 1135: 
 1136:     {ok, Fd7} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Advise, [write]),
 1137:     {error, einval} = ?PRIM_FILE:advise(Fd7, 0, 0, bad_advise),
 1138:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd7),
 1139: 
 1140:     %% test write without advise, then a read after an advise
 1141:     {ok, Fd8} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Advise, [write]),
 1142:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd8, Line1),
 1143:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd8, Line2),
 1144:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd8),
 1145:     {ok, Fd9} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Advise, [read]),
 1146:     Offset = 0,
 1147:     %% same as a 0 length in some implementations
 1148:     Length = byte_size(Line1) + byte_size(Line2),
 1149:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:advise(Fd9, Offset, Length, sequential),
 1150:     {ok, Line1} = ?PRIM_FILE:read_line(Fd9),
 1151:     {ok, Line2} = ?PRIM_FILE:read_line(Fd9),
 1152:     eof = ?PRIM_FILE:read_line(Fd9),
 1153:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd9),
 1154: 
 1155:     ok.
 1156: 
 1157: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1158: 
 1159: large_write(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1160:     run_large_file_test(Config,
 1161: 			fun(Name) -> do_large_write(Name) end,
 1162: 			"_large_write").
 1163: 
 1164: do_large_write(Name) ->
 1165:     ChunkSize = (256 bsl 20) + 1,	% 256 M + 1
 1166:     Chunks = 16,			% times 16 -> 4 G + 16
 1167:     Base = 100,
 1168:     Interleave = lists:seq(Base+1, Base+Chunks),
 1169:     Chunk = <<0:ChunkSize/unit:8>>,
 1170:     Data = zip_data(lists:duplicate(Chunks, Chunk), Interleave),
 1171:     Size = Chunks * ChunkSize + Chunks,	% 4 G + 32
 1172:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write_file(Name, Data),
 1173:     {ok,#file_info{size=Size}} = file:read_file_info(Name),
 1174:     {ok,Fd} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Name, [read]),
 1175:     check_large_write(Fd, ChunkSize, 0, Interleave).
 1176: 
 1177: check_large_write(Fd, ChunkSize, Pos, [X|Interleave]) ->
 1178:     Pos1 = Pos + ChunkSize,
 1179:     {ok,Pos1} = ?PRIM_FILE:position(Fd, {cur,ChunkSize}),
 1180:     {ok,<<X>>} = ?PRIM_FILE:read(Fd, 1),
 1181:     check_large_write(Fd, ChunkSize, Pos1+1, Interleave);
 1182: check_large_write(Fd, _, _, []) ->
 1183:     eof = ?PRIM_FILE:read(Fd, 1),
 1184:     ok.
 1185: 
 1186: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1187: 
 1188: %% Tests that ?PRIM_FILE:allocate/3 at least doesn't crash.
 1189: allocate(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1190:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1191:     Allocate = filename:join(PrivDir,
 1192: 			     atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1193: 			     ++"_allocate.fil"),
 1194: 
 1195:     Line1 = "Hello\n",
 1196:     Line2 = "World!\n",
 1197: 
 1198:     {ok, Fd} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Allocate, [write, binary]),
 1199:     allocate_and_assert(Fd, 1, iolist_size([Line1, Line2])),
 1200:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd, Line1),
 1201:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd, Line2),
 1202:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd),
 1203: 
 1204:     {ok, Fd2} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Allocate, [write, binary]),
 1205:     allocate_and_assert(Fd2, 1, iolist_size(Line1)),
 1206:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd2, Line1),
 1207:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd2, Line2),
 1208:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd2),
 1209: 
 1210:     {ok, Fd3} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Allocate, [write, binary]),
 1211:     allocate_and_assert(Fd3, 1, iolist_size(Line1) + 1),
 1212:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd3, Line1),
 1213:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd3, Line2),
 1214:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd3),
 1215: 
 1216:     {ok, Fd4} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Allocate, [write, binary]),
 1217:     allocate_and_assert(Fd4, 1, 4 * iolist_size([Line1, Line2])),
 1218:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd4, Line1),
 1219:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd4, Line2),
 1220:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd4),
 1221: 
 1222:     ok.
 1223: 
 1224: allocate_and_assert(Fd, Offset, Length) ->
 1225:     %% Just verify that calls to ?PRIM_FILE:allocate/3 don't crash or have
 1226:     %% any other negative side effect. We can't really assert against a
 1227:     %% specific return value, because support for file space pre-allocation
 1228:     %% depends on the OS, OS version and underlying filesystem.
 1229:     %%
 1230:     %% The Linux kernel added support for fallocate() in version 2.6.23,
 1231:     %% which currently works only for the ext4, ocfs2, xfs and btrfs file
 1232:     %% systems. posix_fallocate() is available in glibc as of version
 1233:     %% 2.1.94, but it was buggy until glibc version 2.7.
 1234:     %%
 1235:     %% Mac OS X, as of version 10.3, supports the fcntl operation F_PREALLOCATE.
 1236:     %%
 1237:     %% Solaris supports posix_fallocate() but only for the UFS file system
 1238:     %% apparently (not supported for ZFS).
 1239:     %%
 1240:     %% FreeBSD 9.0 is the first FreeBSD release supporting posix_fallocate().
 1241:     %%
 1242:     %% For Windows there's apparently no way to pre-allocate file space, at
 1243:     %% least with similar API/semantics as posix_fallocate(), fallocate() or
 1244:     %% fcntl F_PREALLOCATE.
 1245:     Result = ?PRIM_FILE:allocate(Fd, Offset, Length),
 1246:     case os:type() of
 1247:         {win32, _} ->
 1248:             {error, enotsup} = Result;
 1249:         _ ->
 1250:             _ = Result
 1251:     end.
 1252: 
 1253: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1254: 
 1255: delete(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1256:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1257:     Name = filename:join(RootDir,
 1258: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1259: 			 ++"_delete.fil"),
 1260:     {ok, Fd1} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Name, [write]),
 1261:     ?PRIM_FILE:write(Fd1,"ok.\n"),
 1262:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd1),
 1263:     %% Check that the file is readable
 1264:     {ok, Fd2} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Name, [read]),
 1265:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd2),
 1266:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:delete(Name),
 1267:     %% Check that the file is not readable anymore
 1268:     {error, _} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Name, [read]),
 1269:     %% Try deleting a nonexistent file
 1270:     {error, enoent} = ?PRIM_FILE:delete(Name),
 1271:     ok.
 1272: 
 1273: rename(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1274:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1275:     FileName1 = atom_to_list(?MODULE)++"_rename.fil",
 1276:     FileName2 = atom_to_list(?MODULE)++"_rename.ful",
 1277:     Name1 = filename:join(RootDir, FileName1),
 1278:     Name2 = filename:join(RootDir, FileName2),
 1279:     {ok,Fd1} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Name1, [write]),
 1280:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd1),
 1281:     %% Rename, and check that it really changed name
 1282:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:rename(Name1, Name2),
 1283:     {error, _} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Name1, [read]),
 1284:     {ok, Fd2} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Name2, [read]),
 1285:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd2),
 1286:     %% Try renaming something to itself
 1287:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:rename(Name2, Name2),
 1288:     %% Try renaming something that doesn't exist
 1289:     {error, enoent} =
 1290: 	?PRIM_FILE:rename(Name1, Name2),
 1291:     %% Try renaming to something else than a string
 1292:     {error, badarg} =
 1293: 	?PRIM_FILE:rename(Name1, foobar),
 1294: 
 1295:     %% Move between directories
 1296:     DirName1 = filename:join(RootDir,
 1297: 			     atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1298: 			     ++"_rename_dir"),
 1299:     DirName2 = filename:join(RootDir,
 1300: 			     atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1301: 			     ++"_second_rename_dir"),
 1302:     Name1foo = filename:join(DirName1, "foo.fil"),
 1303:     Name2foo = filename:join(DirName2, "foo.fil"),
 1304:     Name2bar = filename:join(DirName2, "bar.dir"),
 1305:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:make_dir(DirName1),
 1306:     %% The name has to include the full file name, path is not enough
 1307:     expect(
 1308:       {error, eexist}, {error, eisdir},
 1309:       ?PRIM_FILE:rename(Name2, DirName1)),
 1310:     ok =
 1311: 	?PRIM_FILE:rename(Name2, Name1foo),
 1312:     %% Now rename the directory
 1313:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:rename(DirName1, DirName2),
 1314:     %% And check that the file is there now
 1315:     {ok,Fd3} = ?PRIM_FILE:open(Name2foo, [read]),
 1316:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:close(Fd3),
 1317:     %% Try some dirty things now: move the directory into itself
 1318:     {error, Msg1} =
 1319: 	?PRIM_FILE:rename(DirName2, Name2bar),
 1320:     io:format("Errmsg1: ~p",[Msg1]),
 1321:     %% move dir into a file in itself
 1322:     {error, Msg2} =
 1323: 	?PRIM_FILE:rename(DirName2, Name2foo),
 1324:     io:format("Errmsg2: ~p",[Msg2]),
 1325: 
 1326:     ok.
 1327: 
 1328: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1329: 
 1330: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1331: 
 1332: 
 1333: e_delete(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1334:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1335:     Base = filename:join(RootDir,
 1336: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)++"_e_delete"),
 1337:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:make_dir(Base),
 1338: 
 1339:     %% Delete a non-existing file.
 1340:     {error, enoent} =
 1341: 	?PRIM_FILE:delete(filename:join(Base, "non_existing")),
 1342: 
 1343:     %% Delete a directory.
 1344:     {error, eperm} = ?PRIM_FILE:delete(Base),
 1345: 
 1346:     %% Use a path-name with a non-directory component.
 1347:     Afile = filename:join(Base, "a_file"),
 1348:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write_file(Afile, "hello\n"),
 1349:     {error, E} =
 1350: 	expect(
 1351: 	  {error, enotdir}, {error, enoent}, 
 1352: 	  ?PRIM_FILE:delete(filename:join(Afile, "another_file"))),
 1353:     io:format("Result: ~p~n", [E]),
 1354: 
 1355:     %% No permission.
 1356:     case os:type() of
 1357: 	{win32, _} ->
 1358: 	    %% Remove a character device.
 1359: 	    expect({error, eacces}, {error, einval},
 1360:                    ?PRIM_FILE:delete("nul"));
 1361: 	_ ->
 1362: 	    ?PRIM_FILE:write_file_info(
 1363: 	       Base, #file_info {mode=0}),
 1364: 	    {error, eacces} = ?PRIM_FILE:delete(Afile),
 1365: 	    ?PRIM_FILE:write_file_info(
 1366: 	       Base, #file_info {mode=8#700})
 1367:     end,
 1368: 
 1369:     ok.
 1370: 
 1371: %%% FreeBSD gives EEXIST when renaming a file to an empty dir, although the
 1372: %%% manual page can be interpreted as saying that EISDIR should be given.
 1373: %%% (What about FreeBSD? We store our nightly build results on a FreeBSD
 1374: %%% file system, that's what.)
 1375: 
 1376: e_rename(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1377:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1378:     Base = filename:join(RootDir,
 1379: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)++"_e_rename"),
 1380:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:make_dir(Base),
 1381: 
 1382:     %% Create an empty directory.
 1383:     EmptyDir = filename:join(Base, "empty_dir"),
 1384:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:make_dir(EmptyDir),
 1385: 
 1386:     %% Create a non-empty directory.
 1387:     NonEmptyDir = filename:join(Base, "non_empty_dir"),
 1388:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:make_dir(NonEmptyDir),
 1389:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write_file(
 1390: 	    filename:join(NonEmptyDir, "a_file"),
 1391: 	    "hello\n"),
 1392: 
 1393:     %% Create another non-empty directory.
 1394:     ADirectory = filename:join(Base, "a_directory"),
 1395:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:make_dir(ADirectory),
 1396:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write_file(
 1397: 	    filename:join(ADirectory, "a_file"),
 1398: 	    "howdy\n\n"),
 1399: 
 1400:     %% Create a data file.
 1401:     File = filename:join(Base, "just_a_file"),
 1402:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write_file(File, "anything goes\n\n"),
 1403: 
 1404:     %% Move an existing directory to a non-empty directory.
 1405:     {error, eexist} =
 1406: 	?PRIM_FILE:rename(ADirectory, NonEmptyDir),
 1407: 
 1408:     %% Move a root directory.
 1409:     {error, einval} = ?PRIM_FILE:rename("/", "arne"),
 1410: 
 1411:     %% Move Base into Base/new_name.
 1412:     {error, einval} =
 1413: 	?PRIM_FILE:rename(Base, filename:join(Base, "new_name")),
 1414: 
 1415:     %% Overwrite a directory with a file.
 1416:     expect({error, eexist}, % FreeBSD (?)
 1417: 	   {error, eisdir},
 1418: 	   ?PRIM_FILE:rename(File, EmptyDir)),
 1419:     expect({error, eexist}, % FreeBSD (?)
 1420: 	   {error, eisdir},
 1421: 	   ?PRIM_FILE:rename(File, NonEmptyDir)),
 1422: 
 1423:     %% Move a non-existing file.
 1424:     NonExistingFile = filename:join(
 1425: 			Base, "non_existing_file"),
 1426:     {error, enoent} =
 1427: 	?PRIM_FILE:rename(NonExistingFile, NonEmptyDir),
 1428: 
 1429:     %% Overwrite a file with a directory.
 1430:     expect({error, eexist}, % FreeBSD (?)
 1431: 	   {error, enotdir},
 1432: 	   ?PRIM_FILE:rename(ADirectory, File)),
 1433: 
 1434:     %% Move a file to another filesystem.
 1435:     %% XXX - This test case is bogus. We cannot be guaranteed that
 1436:     %%       the source and destination are on 
 1437:     %%       different filesystems.
 1438:     %%
 1439:     %% XXX - Gross hack!
 1440:     Comment =
 1441: 	case os:type() of
 1442: 	    {win32, _} ->
 1443: 		%% At least Windows NT can
 1444: 		%% successfully move a file to
 1445: 		%% another drive.
 1446: 		ok;
 1447: 	    _ ->
 1448: 		OtherFs = "/tmp",
 1449: 		NameOnOtherFs =
 1450: 		    filename:join(OtherFs,
 1451: 				  filename:basename(File)),
 1452: 		{ok, Com} =
 1453: 		    case ?PRIM_FILE:rename(
 1454: 			    File, NameOnOtherFs) of
 1455: 			{error, exdev} ->
 1456: 			    %% The file could be in
 1457: 			    %% the same filesystem!
 1458: 			    {ok, ok};
 1459: 			ok ->
 1460: 			    {ok, {comment,
 1461: 				  "Moving between filesystems "
 1462: 				  "succeeded, files are probably "
 1463: 				  "in the same filesystem!"}};
 1464: 			{error, eperm} ->
 1465: 			    {ok, {comment, "SBS! You don't "
 1466: 				  "have the permission to do "
 1467: 				  "this test!"}};
 1468: 			Else ->
 1469: 			    Else
 1470: 		    end,
 1471: 		Com
 1472: 	end,
 1473:     Comment.
 1474: 
 1475: e_make_dir(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1476:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1477:     Base = filename:join(RootDir,
 1478: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)++"_e_make_dir"),
 1479:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:make_dir(Base),
 1480: 
 1481:     %% A component of the path does not exist.
 1482:     {error, enoent} =
 1483: 	?PRIM_FILE:make_dir(filename:join([Base, "a", "b"])),
 1484: 
 1485:     %% Use a path-name with a non-directory component.
 1486:     Afile = filename:join(Base, "a_directory"),
 1487:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write_file(Afile, "hello\n"),
 1488:     case ?PRIM_FILE:make_dir(
 1489: 	    filename:join(Afile, "another_directory")) of
 1490: 	{error, enotdir} -> io:format("Result: enotdir");
 1491: 	{error, enoent} -> io:format("Result: enoent")
 1492:     end,
 1493: 
 1494:     %% No permission (on Unix only).
 1495:     case os:type() of
 1496: 	{win32, _} ->
 1497: 	    ok;
 1498: 	_ ->
 1499: 	    ?PRIM_FILE:write_file_info(Base, #file_info {mode=0}),
 1500: 	    {error, eacces} =
 1501: 		?PRIM_FILE:make_dir(filename:join(Base, "xxxx")),
 1502: 	    ?PRIM_FILE:write_file_info(Base, #file_info {mode=8#700})
 1503:     end,
 1504:     ok.
 1505: 
 1506: e_del_dir(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1507:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1508:     Base = filename:join(RootDir,
 1509: 			 atom_to_list(?MODULE)++"_e_del_dir"),
 1510:     io:format("Base: ~p", [Base]),
 1511:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:make_dir(Base),
 1512: 
 1513:     %% Delete a non-existent directory.
 1514:     {error, enoent} =
 1515: 	?PRIM_FILE:del_dir(filename:join(Base, "non_existing")),
 1516: 
 1517:     %% Use a path-name with a non-directory component.
 1518:     Afile = filename:join(Base, "a_directory"),
 1519:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write_file(Afile, "hello\n"),
 1520:     {error, E1} =
 1521: 	expect({error, enotdir}, {error, enoent},
 1522: 	       ?PRIM_FILE:del_dir(
 1523: 		  filename:join(Afile, "another_directory"))),
 1524:     io:format("Result: ~p", [E1]),
 1525: 
 1526:     %% Delete a non-empty directory.
 1527:     %% Delete a non-empty directory.
 1528:     {error, E2} =
 1529: 	expect({error, enotempty}, {error, eexist}, {error, eacces},
 1530: 	       ?PRIM_FILE:del_dir(Base)),
 1531:     io:format("Result: ~p", [E2]),
 1532: 
 1533:     %% Remove the current directory.
 1534:     {error, E3} =
 1535: 	expect({error, einval}, 
 1536: 	       {error, eperm}, % Linux and DUX
 1537: 	       {error, eacces},
 1538: 	       {error, ebusy},
 1539: 	       ?PRIM_FILE:del_dir(".")),
 1540:     io:format("Result: ~p", [E3]),
 1541: 
 1542:     %% No permission.
 1543:     case os:type() of
 1544: 	{win32, _} ->
 1545: 	    ok;
 1546: 	_ ->
 1547: 	    ADirectory = filename:join(Base, "no_perm"),
 1548: 	    ok = ?PRIM_FILE:make_dir(ADirectory),
 1549: 	    ?PRIM_FILE:write_file_info(Base, #file_info {mode=0}),
 1550: 	    {error, eacces} = ?PRIM_FILE:del_dir(ADirectory),
 1551: 	    ?PRIM_FILE:write_file_info(
 1552: 	       Base, #file_info {mode=8#700})
 1553:     end,
 1554:     ok.
 1555: 
 1556: 
 1557: make_link(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1558:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1559:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
 1560: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1561: 			   ++"_make_link"),
 1562:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:make_dir(NewDir),
 1563: 
 1564:     Name = filename:join(NewDir, "a_file"),
 1565:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write_file(Name, "some contents\n"),
 1566: 
 1567:     Alias = filename:join(NewDir, "an_alias"),
 1568:     Result =
 1569: 	case ?PRIM_FILE:make_link(Name, Alias) of
 1570: 	    {error, enotsup} ->
 1571: 		{skipped, "Links not supported on this platform"};
 1572: 	    ok ->
 1573: 		%% Note: We take the opportunity to test 
 1574: 		%% ?PRIM_FILE:read_link_info/1,
 1575: 		%% which should in behave exactly as 
 1576: 		%% ?PRIM_FILE:read_file_info/1
 1577: 		%% since they are not used on symbolic links.
 1578: 
 1579: 		{ok, Info} =
 1580: 		    ?PRIM_FILE:read_link_info(Name),
 1581: 		{ok, Info} =
 1582: 		    ?PRIM_FILE:read_link_info(Alias),
 1583: 		#file_info{links = 2, type = regular} = Info,
 1584: 		{error, eexist} =
 1585: 		    ?PRIM_FILE:make_link(Name, Alias),
 1586: 		ok
 1587: 	end,
 1588: 
 1589:     Result.
 1590: 
 1591: %% Test that reading link info for an ordinary file or directory works
 1592: %% (on all platforms).
 1593: read_link_info_for_non_link(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1594:     {ok, #file_info{type=directory}} = ?PRIM_FILE:read_link_info("."),
 1595:     ok.
 1596: 
 1597: symlinks(Config) when is_list(Config)  ->
 1598:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1599:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
 1600: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1601: 			   ++"_make_symlink"),
 1602:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:make_dir(NewDir),
 1603: 
 1604:     Name = filename:join(NewDir, "a_plain_file"),
 1605:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write_file(Name, "some stupid content\n"),
 1606: 
 1607:     Alias = filename:join(NewDir, "a_symlink_alias"),
 1608:     Result =
 1609: 	case ?PRIM_FILE:make_symlink(Name, Alias) of
 1610: 	    {error, enotsup} ->
 1611: 		{skipped, "Links not supported on this platform"};
 1612: 	    {error, eperm} ->
 1613: 		{win32,_} = os:type(),
 1614: 		{skipped, "Windows user not privileged to create links"};
 1615: 	    ok ->
 1616: 		{ok, Info1} =
 1617: 		    ?PRIM_FILE:read_file_info(Name),
 1618: 		{ok, Info1} =
 1619: 		    ?PRIM_FILE:read_file_info(Alias),
 1620: 		{ok, Info1} =
 1621: 		    ?PRIM_FILE:read_link_info(Name),
 1622: 		#file_info{links = 1, type = regular} = Info1,
 1623: 
 1624: 		{ok, Info2} =
 1625: 		    ?PRIM_FILE:read_link_info(Alias),
 1626: 		#file_info{links=1, type=symlink} = Info2,
 1627: 		{ok, Name} =
 1628: 		    ?PRIM_FILE:read_link(Alias),
 1629: 		{ok, Name} =
 1630: 		    ?PRIM_FILE:read_link_all(Alias),
 1631: 		%% If all is good, delete dir again (avoid hanging dir on windows)
 1632: 		rm_rf(?PRIM_FILE,NewDir),
 1633: 		ok
 1634: 	end,
 1635: 
 1636:     Result.
 1637: 
 1638: %% Creates as many files as possible during a certain time, 
 1639: %% periodically calls list_dir/2 to check if it works,
 1640: %% then deletes all files.
 1641: 
 1642: %% Tests if large directories can be read.
 1643: list_dir_limit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1644:     MaxTime = 120,
 1645:     MaxNumber = 20000,
 1646:     ct:timetrap({seconds,2*MaxTime + MaxTime}),
 1647:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1648:     NewDir = filename:join(RootDir,
 1649: 			   atom_to_list(?MODULE)++"_list_dir_limit"),
 1650:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:make_dir(NewDir),
 1651:     Ref = erlang:start_timer(MaxTime*1000, self(), []),
 1652:     Result = list_dir_limit_loop(NewDir, Ref, MaxNumber, 0),
 1653:     Time = case erlang:cancel_timer(Ref) of
 1654: 	       false -> MaxTime;
 1655: 	       T -> MaxTime - (T div 1000)
 1656: 	   end,
 1657:     Number = case Result of
 1658: 		 {ok, N} -> N;
 1659: 		 {error, _Reason, N} -> N;
 1660: 		 _ -> 0
 1661: 	     end,
 1662:     list_dir_limit_cleanup(NewDir, Number, 0),
 1663:     {ok, Number} = Result,
 1664:     {comment, 
 1665:      "Created " ++ integer_to_list(Number) ++ " files in " 
 1666:      ++ integer_to_list(Time) ++ " seconds."}.
 1667: 
 1668: list_dir_limit_loop(Dir, _Ref, N, Cnt) when Cnt >= N ->
 1669:     list_dir_check(Dir, Cnt);
 1670: list_dir_limit_loop(Dir, Ref, N, Cnt) ->
 1671:     receive 
 1672: 	{timeout, Ref, []} -> 
 1673: 	    list_dir_check(Dir, Cnt)
 1674:     after 0 ->
 1675: 	    Name = integer_to_list(Cnt),
 1676: 	    case ?PRIM_FILE:write_file(filename:join(Dir, Name), Name) of
 1677: 		ok ->
 1678: 		    Next = Cnt + 1,
 1679: 		    case Cnt rem 100 of
 1680: 			0 ->
 1681: 			    case list_dir_check(Dir, Next) of
 1682: 				{ok, Next} ->
 1683: 				    list_dir_limit_loop(
 1684: 				      Dir, Ref, N, Next);
 1685: 				Other ->
 1686: 				    Other
 1687: 			    end;
 1688: 			_ ->
 1689: 			    list_dir_limit_loop(Dir, Ref, N, Next)
 1690: 		    end;
 1691: 		{error, Reason} ->
 1692: 		    {error, Reason, Cnt}
 1693: 	    end
 1694:     end.
 1695: 
 1696: list_dir_check(Dir, Cnt) ->
 1697:     case ?PRIM_FILE:list_dir(Dir) of
 1698: 	{ok, ListDir} ->
 1699: 	    case length(ListDir) of
 1700: 		Cnt ->
 1701: 		    {ok, Cnt};
 1702: 		X ->
 1703: 		    {error, 
 1704: 		     {wrong_nof_files, X, ?LINE},
 1705: 		     Cnt}
 1706: 	    end;
 1707: 	{error, Reason} ->
 1708: 	    {error, Reason, Cnt}
 1709:     end.
 1710: 
 1711: %% Deletes N files while ignoring errors, then continues deleting
 1712: %% as long as they exist.
 1713: 
 1714: list_dir_limit_cleanup(Dir, N, Cnt) when Cnt >= N ->
 1715:     Name = integer_to_list(Cnt),
 1716:     case ?PRIM_FILE:delete(filename:join(Dir, Name)) of
 1717: 	ok ->
 1718: 	    list_dir_limit_cleanup(Dir, N, Cnt+1);
 1719: 	_ ->
 1720: 	    ok
 1721:     end;
 1722: list_dir_limit_cleanup(Dir, N, Cnt) ->
 1723:     Name = integer_to_list(Cnt),
 1724:     ?PRIM_FILE:delete(filename:join(Dir, Name)),
 1725:     list_dir_limit_cleanup(Dir, N, Cnt+1).
 1726: 
 1727: %%%
 1728: %%% Test list_dir() on a non-existing pathname.
 1729: %%%
 1730: 
 1731: list_dir_error(Config) ->
 1732:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1733:     NonExisting = filename:join(Priv, "non-existing-dir"),
 1734:     {error,enoent} = ?PRIM_FILE:list_dir(NonExisting),
 1735:     ok.
 1736: 
 1737: %%%
 1738: %%% Test list_dir() and list_dir_all().
 1739: %%%
 1740: 
 1741: list_dir(Config) ->
 1742:     RootDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1743:     TestDir = filename:join(RootDir, ?MODULE_STRING++"_list_dir"),
 1744:     ?PRIM_FILE:make_dir(TestDir),
 1745:     list_dir_1(TestDir, 42, []).
 1746: 
 1747: list_dir_1(TestDir, 0, Sorted) ->
 1748:     [ok = ?PRIM_FILE:delete(filename:join(TestDir, F)) ||
 1749: 	F <- Sorted],
 1750:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:del_dir(TestDir);
 1751: list_dir_1(TestDir, Cnt, Sorted0) ->
 1752:     Base = "file" ++ integer_to_list(Cnt),
 1753:     Name = filename:join(TestDir, Base),
 1754:     ok = ?PRIM_FILE:write_file(Name, Base),
 1755:     Sorted = lists:merge([Base], Sorted0),
 1756:     {ok,DirList0} = ?PRIM_FILE:list_dir(TestDir),
 1757:     {ok,DirList1} = ?PRIM_FILE:list_dir_all(TestDir),
 1758:     Sorted = lists:sort(DirList0),
 1759:     Sorted = lists:sort(DirList1),
 1760:     list_dir_1(TestDir, Cnt-1, Sorted).
 1761: 
 1762: %%%
 1763: %%% Support for testing large files.
 1764: %%%
 1765: 
 1766: run_large_file_test(Config, Run, Name) ->
 1767:     case {erlang:system_info(wordsize),os:type(),os:version()} of
 1768: 	{8,{win32,nt},_} ->
 1769: 	    do_run_large_file_test(Config, Run, Name);
 1770: 	{8,{unix,sunos},OsVersion} when OsVersion < {5,5,1} ->
 1771: 	    {skip,"Only supported on Win32, Unix or SunOS >= 5.5.1"};
 1772: 	{8,{unix,_},_} ->
 1773: 	    DiscFree = unix_free(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
 1774:             MemFree = free_memory(),
 1775: 	    io:format("Free disk: ~w KByte~n", [DiscFree]),
 1776: 	    io:format("Free mem: ~w MByte~n", [MemFree]),
 1777: 	    if DiscFree < 5 bsl 20; MemFree < 5 bsl 10 ->
 1778: 		    %% Less than 5 GByte free
 1779: 		    {skip,"Less than 5 GByte free disk/mem"};
 1780: 	       true ->
 1781: 		    do_run_large_file_test(Config, Run, Name)
 1782: 	    end;
 1783: 	_ -> 
 1784: 	    {skip,"Only supported on Win32, Unix or SunOS >= 5.5.1"}
 1785:     end.
 1786: 
 1787: 
 1788: do_run_large_file_test(Config, Run, Name0) ->
 1789:     Name = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1790: 			 ?MODULE_STRING ++ Name0),
 1791: 
 1792:     %% Set up a process that will delete this file.
 1793:     Tester = self(),
 1794:     Deleter = 
 1795: 	spawn(
 1796: 	  fun() ->
 1797: 		  Mref = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 1798: 		  receive
 1799: 		      {'DOWN',Mref,_,_,_} -> ok;
 1800: 		      {Tester,done} -> ok
 1801: 		  end,
 1802: 		  ?PRIM_FILE:delete(Name)
 1803: 	  end),
 1804: 
 1805:     %% Run the test case.
 1806:     Res = Run(Name),
 1807: 
 1808:     %% Delete file and finish deleter process.
 1809:     Mref = erlang:monitor(process, Deleter),
 1810:     Deleter ! {Tester,done},
 1811:     receive {'DOWN',Mref,_,_,_} -> ok end,
 1812: 
 1813:     Res.
 1814: 
 1815: unix_free(Path) ->
 1816:     Cmd = ["df -k '",Path,"'"],
 1817:     DF0 = os:cmd(Cmd),
 1818:     io:format("$ ~s~n~s", [Cmd,DF0]),
 1819:     Lines = re:split(DF0, "\n", [trim,{return,list}]),
 1820:     Last = lists:last(Lines),
 1821:     RE = "^[^\\s]*\\s+\\d+\\s+\\d+\\s+(\\d+)",
 1822:     {match,[Avail]} = re:run(Last, RE, [{capture,all_but_first,list}]),
 1823:     list_to_integer(Avail).
 1824: 
 1825: zip_data([A|As], [B|Bs]) ->
 1826:     [[A,B]|zip_data(As, Bs)];
 1827: zip_data([], Bs) ->
 1828:     Bs;
 1829: zip_data(As, []) ->
 1830:     As.
 1831: 
 1832: %% Stolen from emulator -> alloc_SUITE
 1833: free_memory() ->
 1834:     %% Free memory in MB.
 1835:     try
 1836: 	SMD = memsup:get_system_memory_data(),
 1837: 	{value, {free_memory, Free}} = lists:keysearch(free_memory, 1, SMD),
 1838: 	TotFree = (Free +
 1839: 		   case lists:keysearch(cached_memory, 1, SMD) of
 1840: 		       {value, {cached_memory, Cached}} -> Cached;
 1841: 		       false -> 0
 1842: 		   end +
 1843: 		   case lists:keysearch(buffered_memory, 1, SMD) of
 1844: 		       {value, {buffered_memory, Buffed}} -> Buffed;
 1845: 		       false -> 0
 1846: 		   end),
 1847: 	usable_mem(TotFree) div (1024*1024)
 1848:     catch
 1849: 	error : undef ->
 1850: 	    ct:fail({"os_mon not built"})
 1851:     end.
 1852: 
 1853: usable_mem(Memory) ->
 1854:     case test_server:is_valgrind() of
 1855:         true ->
 1856:             %% Valgrind uses extra memory for the V- and A-bits.
 1857:             %% http://valgrind.org/docs/manual/mc-manual.html#mc-manual.value
 1858:             %% Docs says it uses "compression to represent the V bits compactly"
 1859:             %% but let's be conservative and cut usable memory in half.
 1860:             Memory div 2;
 1861:         false ->
 1862:             Memory
 1863:     end.
 1864: 
 1865: 
 1866: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 1867: %%% Utilities
 1868: rm_rf(Mod,Dir) ->
 1869:     case  Mod:read_link_info(Dir) of
 1870: 	{ok, #file_info{type = directory}} ->
 1871: 	    {ok, Content} = Mod:list_dir_all(Dir),
 1872: 	    [ rm_rf(Mod,filename:join(Dir,C)) || C <- Content ],
 1873: 	    Mod:del_dir(Dir),
 1874: 	    ok;
 1875: 	{ok, #file_info{}} ->
 1876: 	    Mod:delete(Dir);
 1877: 	_ ->
 1878: 	    ok
 1879:     end.
